question:

I. Between

II. Bedroom

III. Beside

IV. Beverage

V. Believe
solution:

question:
Select the option that is related to the fifth term in the same way as the second term is related to the first term and the fourth term is related to the third term.

22 : 528:: 19: 399:: 34: ?
solution:
22 : 22 x (22+2) = 22 x 24 = 528

19: 19 x 21 = 399

Similarly,

34: 34 x 36 = 1224

So, option (a) is the correct answer.

question:
'A @ B' means 'A is the mother of B'

'A % B' means 'A is the sister of B'

'A # B' means 'A is the father of B'

'A & B' means 'A is the wife of B'

As per which of the following expressions 'M is the grandmother of Q'?
solution:
Option (a): L & M # P # C @ Q

L & M means 'L is the wife of M'

M # P means 'M is the father of P'

P # C means 'P is the father of C'

C @ Q means 'C is the mother of Q'

M is father of grandfather of Q.

Option (b): M @ N & O # P % Q

M @ N means 'M is the mother of N'

N & O means 'N is the wife of O'

O # P means 'O is the father of P'

P % Q means 'P is the sister of Q'

M is the grandmother of Q.

Option (c): Q % C # N & D @ M

Q % C means 'Q is the sister of C'

C # N means 'C is the father of N'

N & D means 'N is the wife of D'

D # M means 'D is the father of M'

M is either grandson or granddaughter of Q's brother.

Option (d): M & P # L % O & Q

M & P means 'M is the wife of P'

P # L means 'P is the father of L'

L % O means 'L is the sister of O'

O & Q means 'O is the wife of Q'

M is the mother-in-law of Q.

Thus, the answer is option (b).

question: 24 is related to 600 following a certain logic. Following the same logic, 18 is related to 342. Which of the following numbers is related to 30 using the same logic?
solution:
24 + 242 = 600

18 + 182 = 342

Similarly, 30 + 302 = 930

Thus, the answer is option (b).

question:

Business : Revenue :: Labour : ?
solution:
The earnings in business is known as 'Revenue'.

Similarly, the earning of Labour is known as 'Wages'.

question:
If '-' is coded as 'x', '÷' is coded as '+', 'x' is coded as '÷' and '+' is coded as '-', then find the value of the following expression.

(450 + 225) x 15 - (64 ÷ 39) = ?
solution:
(450 + 225) x 15 - (64 ÷ 39) = ?

After the interchange of signs:

(450 - 225) ÷ 15 x (64 + 39) = ?

225 ÷ 15 x 103 = ?

15 x 103 = ?

? = 1545

So, option (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Two orientations of the same cube are shown. How will this cube look when unfolded?


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p20215/image010.jpg
https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p20215/image011.jpg
solution:
In this type of format,

2 lies opposite 4; 3 lies opposite to 5 and 1 lies opposite to 6.

Figure I: 11 lies opposite 15; 14 lies opposite to 16 and 13 lies opposite to 12.

Thus, 11 is not adjacent to 15, 14 is not adjacent to 16 and 13 is not adjacent to 12.

So, figure I is incorrect.

Figure II: 12 lies opposite 14; 16 lies opposite to 15 and 11 lies opposite to 13.

Thus, 12 is not adjacent to 14, 16 is not adjacent to 15 and 11 is not adjacent to 13.

So, figure II is incorrect.

Figure III: 11 lies opposite 14; 15 lies opposite to 16 and 12 lies opposite to 13.

Thus, 11 is not adjacent to 14, 15 is not adjacent to 16 and 12 is not adjacent to 13.

So, figure III is incorrect.

Figure IV: 13 lies opposite 11; 15 lies opposite to 12 and 16 lies opposite to 14.

Thus, 13 is not adjacent to 11, 15 is not adjacent to 12 and 16 is not adjacent to 14.

So, figure IV is correct.

question:
In the question given below, three statements are given followed by two conclusions. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Read the conclusions and decide which of the given conclusions logically follow from the given statements disregarding the commonly known facts.

Statements:

All A1 is B2

All C3 is E5

All E5 is A1

Conclusions:

I. No C3 is B2

II. Some A1 is C3
solution:
No C3 is B2: All C3 is B2. So, conclusion I is false.

Some A1 is C3: All C3 is E5 and all E5 is A1. So, some A1 is C3. So, conclusion II is true.

question:
In the given question, two statements are given followed by three conclusions. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Read the conclusions and decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statements:

Some connects are networks.

No network is a project.

Conclusions:

I. No project is a connect.

II. Some networks are connects.

III. All projects are connects.
solution:
Some connects are networks. No network is a project.

Some connects may or may not be projects. So, conclusions I and III do not follow. Some networks are connects is true. So, only conclusion II follows.

question:
By interchanging the given two numbers (not digits), which of the following equation will be correct?

2 and 16

I. 3 + 2 X 20 - 18 ÷ 16 = 314

II. 192 ÷ 2 + 24 - 16 X 17 = 8
solution:
If the numbers 2 and 16 are interchanged, then the equation will be:

I. 3 + 16 X 20 - 18 ÷ 2

= 3 + 320 - 9

= 323 - 9

= 314.

Thus, equation I will be correct.

II. 192 ÷ 16 + 24 - 2 X 17

= 12 + 24 - 34

= 36 - 34

= 2.

Thus, equation II will be incorrect.

question: The positions of how many letters will remain unchanged in the word RADIANTLY if the first three letters are arranged in alphabetical order, then next three letters are arranged in the alphabetical order and then remaining letters are arranged in alphabetical order?
solution:
The first three letters are arranged in alphabetical order, then next three letters are arranged in the alphabetical order and then remaining letters are arranged in alphabetical order, so we get:

RADIANTLY
ADRAINLTY

So, positions of two letters remain unchanged.

question: Any bill or any amendment brought under Article ______ is called Constitutional Amendment Act.
solution:
Any bill or any amendment brought under Article 368 is called Constitutional Amendment Act.

Why Article 368:

- Power to Amend: The Constitution, like any foundational legal document, needs to be adaptable to changing times and societal needs. Article 368 grants the Parliament the power to amend the Constitution, ensuring its relevance and effectiveness.

- Procedure: The article specifies the specific procedures that must be followed when amending the Constitution. This ensures a structured and considered approach to constitutional changes.

- Special Majorities: In many cases, amending the Constitution requires special majorities in both houses of Parliament, emphasizing the importance of broad consensus for significant changes.

- Limitations: While Article 368 empowers Parliament to amend the Constitution, it also recognizes certain limitations. For instance, the Supreme Court has established the concept of the "basic structure" of the Constitution, which cannot be altered through amendments

question: In May 2024, who defeated World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen in classical chess for the first time in his career?
solution:
18-year-old Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa defeated Magnus Carlsen for the first time in Classical Chess.

Praggnanandhaa took the sole leader position in the open section of Norway Chess.

Norway Chess offers USD 160,000 in prize funds for the Open and the Women's section.

question: The entire sequence of communities in a given area, succeeding each other, during the course of succession is termed ________
solution:
Each transitional (temporary) community that is formed and replaced during succession is called a stage in succession or a seral community.

The terminal (final) stage of succession forms the community which is called the climax community. A climax community is stable, mature, more complex and long lasting.

The entire sequence of communities in a given area, succeeding each other, during the course of succession is termed sere.

Types of Seres: Seres can be classified based on the starting point of succession. Some common types include:

Hydrosere: Succession in water bodies, starting from a pond and progressing towards a terrestrial community.

Xerosere: Succession in dry areas, starting from bare rock and progressing towards a forest.

Lithosere: Succession on bare rock surfaces.

Psammosere: Succession in sandy areas.

question: The body of animals of the phylum Ctenophora, such as sea walnuts, bears eight external rows of ciliated _______,which help in locomotion.
solution:
Ctenophores, commonly known as sea walnuts or comb jellies are exclusively marine, radially symmetrical, diploblastic organisms with tissue level of organisation.

- The body bears eight external rows of ciliated comb plates, which help in locomotion.

- Digestion is both extracellular and intracellular.

- Bioluminescence (the property of a living organism to emit light) is well-marked in ctenophores. Sexes are not separate.

- Reproduction takes place only by sexual means.

- Fertilisation is external with indirect development.

question: Who launched the Independent Labour party in 1937?
solution:
B R Ambedkar launched two political parties. The first one was the Independent Labour party in 1937 and the second Scheduled Caste Federation in 1942.

The colonial government recognizing his struggles and also to balance its support base used the services of Ambedkar.

Thus he was made a member of the Defence Advisory Committee in 1942, and a few months later, a minister in the Viceroy's cabinet.

question: Regur soil is suitable for the cultivation of______.
solution: Black soil covers most of the Deccan Plateau which includes parts of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh and some parts of Tamil Nadu. In the upper reaches of the Godavari and the Krishna, and the north western part of the Deccan Plateau, the black soil is very deep. These soils are also known as the 'Regur Soil' or the 'Black Cotton Soil' which is suitable for the cultivation of cotton.

question: Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri is an Indian ___ player.
solution: Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri is an Indian tabla player. In 1996, Swapan Chaudhuri received the Sangeet Natak Academy Award from the President of India, the highest awards for Classical Music in India. In 2019, he received the Padma Shri, one of India's highest honor from the Indian government

question: What does the term 'let' in racket games mean?
option_4: Ball in play touches a permanent fixture
solution: Let, short for 'let it be replayed' is a shot or point in racket games that does not count and must be replayed. Should the ball on service strike the top of the net before falling in the correct service zone, it is a let and is replayed.

question: The 'Doctrine of Lapse' policy, which annexed several Indian princely states, was introduced by which British Governor-General?
solution:
The 'Doctrine of Lapse' was a policy introduced by Lord Dalhousie, who served as the Governor-General of India from 1848 to 1856. The doctrine was implemented as a means for the British East India Company to annex Indian princely states that were deemed to be mismanaged or lacked a direct male heir.

· According to this policy, if a ruler of a princely state died without a natural heir, the state would be annexed by the British East India Company rather than allowing the adoption of an heir.

question: Who is the Chairman of the 16th Finance Commission?
solution:
The chairman of the 16th Finance Commission of India is Dr. Arvind Panagariya.

The government appointed former NITI Aayog vice chairman and Columbia University professor Arvind Panagariya as the chairman of the Sixteenth Finance Commission, which will recommend the tax revenue sharing formula between the Centre and the States for the five-year period beginning April 2026.

question: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Maharishi Valmiki International Airport in ________
solution: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Maharishi Valmiki International Airport in the temple town of Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh, shortly after launching the redeveloped Ayodhya railway station and flagging off two Amrit Bharat and six Vande Bharat trains, some virtually. Phase 1 of the state-of-the-art airport has been developed at a cost of more than ₹1450 crore.

question: According to the Census 2011, what is the population density of India?
solution:
· Population density is calculated as the number of persons per unit area. India is one of the most densely populated countries of the world.

· The population density of India as per the Census 2011 is 382 per sq-km.

· Literacy rate: 74.04%; Sex ratio: 940 females/ 1000 males; child sex ratio (0-6 years): 919.

question: Who is called the "Father of Modern Chemistry"?
solution: Antoine Lavoisier is often referred to as the "Father of Modern Chemistry." He is recognized for his significant contributions to the understanding of chemical reactions, the discovery of oxygen's role in combustion, and for pioneering the concept of chemical elements and formulation of the law of conservation of mass.

question: What is the SI unit of Torque?
solution:
• Torque, also called moment of a force, in physics, is the tendency of a force to rotate the body to which it is applied.

• The SI unit of torque is a Newton-metre.

question: In which of the following motion, acceleration is zero?
solution:
Uniform motion is the motion in which acceleration is zero. In uniform motion the velocity of the object is constant and the object moves in a straight line at a constant speed.

Motion in a circle is a type of non-uniform motion, in which the velocity of the object is not constant and the object's direction of motion changes constantly.

Rectilinear motion is a type of motion in which the object moves in a straight line. The acceleration of the object is not necessarily zero.

Non-uniform motion is a type of motion in which the velocity of the object is not constant, and the object's acceleration is not zero.

question: In August 2024, which of the following announced the launch of the initiative "Million Designers, Billion Dreams."?
option_1: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
option_3: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM)
option_4: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
solution:
The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM) announced the launch of the "Million Designers, Billion Dreams" initiative in August 2024. This program aims to empower rural leaders and entrepreneurs across India with systems design skills to tackle complex societal challenges.

Spearheaded by LEAP in collaboration with the DAY-NRLM. LEAP is a catalyst organization that emerged from the multidisciplinary work developed in India by the Design Laboratory at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health (D-Lab) and the Transform Rural India Foundation (TRIF), with seed investment provided by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF).

question: Which article of the Indian Constitution talks about the annual financial statement?
solution:
Article 112 of the Constitution requires the government to present to Parliament a statement of estimated receipts and expenditure in respect of every financial year, from April 1 to March 31.

This statement is called the annual financial statement. It is divided into three parts, Consolidated Fund, Contingency Fund and Public Account.

For each of these funds, the government has to present a statement of receipts and expenditure.

question: 'Bhurs' are locally known sand stretches in which of the following region:
solution:
Bhurs are locally known sandy stretches found in the Upper Ganga Plain.

The Upper Ganga Plain is drained by the Ganga and its tributaries (the Yamuna, the Ram Ganga, the Sarda, the Ghagara, and the Gomati). The plain is about 550 km long and 380 km wide. This plain is relatively flat and featureless. River meanders and oxbow lakes are found here.

question: The machinations of Chanakya against Chandragupta's enemies are described in detail in the book:
solution: The machinations of Chanakya against Chandragupta's enemies are described in detail in the Mudrarakshasa, a drama written by Vishakhadatta in the ninth century. Several plays have been based on it in modern times.

question: Out of the known element in the periodic table, only ______ are gases under normal atmospheric conditions.
solution: Just 11 of the known elements in the periodic table are gases in a typical atmosphere. They are helium (He), argon (Ar), krypton (Kr), xenon (Xe), radon (Ra), nitrogen (N), oxygen (O), fluorine (F), neon (Ne), and chlorine (Cl) (Rn).

question: Saila which is a group dance comprising male performers, who dance with bamboo sticks after cutting crops, belongs to the state of ______.
solution:
Dances in Chhattisgarh primarily showcase the joyous life of the tribal people involving complex footwork and deft swaying movements in groups to the accompaniment of the beatings of drums.

Some of these popular dances are: Saila Dance - a group dance comprising male performers, who dance with bamboo sticks after cutting crops; Suwa or Soowa (parrot) Dance - a group dance performed by female dancers to please the Goddess of Wealth; Karma Dance - a group dance performed by both male and female dancers in praise of the Karam tree; and Raut or Rawat Nacha or Dance - a group dance consisting of a large number of male dancers half of whom play drums and flutes of special kinds while others dance encircling the child member of the team dressed up as Lord Krishna.

question: Who is known as the 'Father of Modern Dance in India'?
solution:
Uday Shankar is known as the 'Father of Modern Dance in India'. He blended Indian classical dance with Western ballet to create a unique style that gained international recognition.

Gopi Krishna was a renowned Indian Kathak dancer, choreographer, and actor. He is celebrated for his exceptional talent and contributions to the world of Kathak dance.

Birju Maharaj was a monumental figure in the world of Kathak dance. Hailing from the illustrious Maharaj family, he was a master of the Lucknow gharana style.

Guru Bipin Singh was a renowned figure in the world of Indian classical dance, particularly known for his expertise in Manipuri dance. He was a director, choreographer, and teacher who played a pivotal role in preserving and promoting this beautiful dance form.

question: What does the term "stagflation" refer to in economics?
option_1: High inflation and high unemployment occurring simultaneously
option_2: Economic growth without inflation or unemployment
solution:
Stagflation is an economic state that occurs when high inflation, high unemployment and stagnant economic growth joins hands together. The term was first coined by Iain Macleod in the United Kingdom in November 1965.

· Generally, when the economy of any country booms, people earn more and thus demand for goods and services increases, which further results in soaring prices and eventually rising inflation. On the other hand, when the economy is in the doldrums and demand is low, the prices of goods and services fall or stagnate.

· While in stagflation, the worst of both scenarios is experienced by the economy as the growth rate becomes stagnant with high unemployment and continuous high inflation.

question: In a balance sheet, the assets reflect _______.
solution: The balance sheet is a statement prepared for showing the financial position of the business summarizing its assets and liabilities at a given date. The assets reflect debit balances and liabilities (including capital) reflect credit balances. It is prepared at the end of the accounting period after the trading and profit and loss accounts have been prepared.

question: Firoz Tughlaq created a new department called Diwan-i-Khairat to take care of ____ and ______.
solution:
· A new department called Diwan-i-Khairat was created by Firoz Tughlaq to take care of orphans and widows.

· Free hospitals and marriage bureaus for poor Muslims were also established.

· Firoz patronized scholars like Barani and Afif.

· As he was guided by the ulemas, he was intolerant towards Shia Muslims and Sufis.

question: In a business partnership, three friends - Raj, Priya, and Mohan - decided to invest in a new project. The total amount of money invested by the trio is Rs. 22,560. Raj invested Rs. 7,200 more than what Priya invested. Additionally, Priya invested 50% more than Mohan. Calculate the difference between the amounts invested by Raj and Mohan.
solution:
Let Mohan invested = 100x

Priya invested = 100x * 150/100 = 150x

Raj invested = 150x + 7,200

100x + 150x + 150x + 7200 = 22,560

x = 38.40

Reqd. difference = 150x + 7,200 - 100x = 50x + 7,200

So the answer = 50 X 38.40 + 7,200 = Rs. 9,120

question: A shopkeeper marks up an article by 45% above its cost price and offers a discount of 18%. Find the profit/loss percent on selling the article.
solution:
Marked price = (145/100) * cost price

Marked price/Cost price = 29/20

We know that,

Marked Price/Cost price = (100 + Profit%)/(100 - Discount%)

29/20 = (100 + Profit%)/82

118.9 = 100 + Profit%

Profit% = 18.9%

question: A runs 1.75 times as fast as B. If A gives B a start of 60 metres, how far must the winning post be so that both A and B reach at the same time?
solution:
Ratio of speeds = 7:4

i.e., 3 metres is gained by A in 7 metres

60 metres is gained by A in (7/3)*60 = 140 m

question: What is the value of (2m - 3n)2 + 4(m + n)2 - (m - 2n)2?
solution:
Here, (2m - 3n)2 + 4(m + n)2 - (m - 2n)2

= 4m2 - 12mn + 9n2 + 4m2 + 8mn + 4n2 - m2 + 4mn - 4n2

= 7m2 + 9n2

question:
The table shows the price of 30 food items in a menu of a restaurant.

Price(in Rs.)Number of items
Less than 1003
Less than 1509
Less than 20015
Less than 25024
Less than 30030

How many food items are listed as Rs.150 or more but less than Rs.250?
solution: Number of food items listed as Rs.150 or more but less than Rs.250 = (24 - 15) + (15 - 9) = 9 + 6 = 15.

question: Two numbers are in the ratio of 7:5. If HCF of the number is 12, then find the difference between the numbers.
solution:
Since, HCF of the numbers = 12

Numbers are 7*12 = 84 and 5*12 = 60

Required difference = 84 - 60 = 24

question:
Pipe A & B can fill a tank in 30

 and 48 mins. respectively. Another pipe C can empty it in 60 minutes. If all three pipes are opened simultaneously, then the empty tank will fill in:
solution:
one minute work of pipe A, B, and C together = (1/30) + (1/48) - (1/60) = 9/240

So, total time taken by all three pipes together = 240/9 = 80/3 minutes

Or, (80/3) * (1/60) hours = 4/9 hours

question: AB is a chord in a circle with centre O. C is a point on AB such that OC is perpendicular to AB. If OC = 4 cm and the circumference of circle is 24π cm, then what is the length of the chord AB?
solution:
Radius of circle = 24π/(2 * π) = 12 cm

In the given circle, AO and OB are radii of the circle and OC is the perpendicular on AB as shown below.

Then, using Pythagoras theorem, we have

AO2 = OC2 + AC2

122 = 42 + AC2

AC = 8√2 cm

Therefore, AB = 2AC = 2 * 8√2 = 16√2 cm


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p11771/image006.jpg

question: If inradius of a triangle is 3.5 cm and perimeter of a triangle is 30 cm. the area of triangle is :
solution:
Semi perimeter of triangle = 30/2 = 15 cm

Area of triangle = semi perimeter * inradius = 15 * 3.5 = 52.5 cm2

question: Due to some reason, some employees from dept X shifted to dept Y, and thereby the number of employees in the dept Y increased by 22.22%. All of them again shifted to dept X from dept Y. Then by what percentage (correct up to two decimal places) did the number of employees in dept Y decrease?
solution:
Let initially, number of employees in dept Y = 10000k

After some employees from dept X shifted to dept Y, number of employees in dept Y becomes = 10000k * 122.22/100 = 12222k

All of them again shifted to dept X from dept Y.

Now percentage decrease in dept Y = (12222k - 10000k)/12222k * 100 = 18.18%

question: A dishonest shopkeeper claims to sell salt at a rate of Rs.38/kg. The cost price of the salt is Rs.38/kg. Not satisfied with this, he tries to make profit by removing 140 gm from each kg. What is the shopkeeper's gain percentage to the nearest whole number?
solution:
Gain% = (faulty weight - actual weight) x 100/actual weight

Gain% = (1000 - 860) x 100/860 = 1400/86 = 16.27 = 16%

question: In triangles XYZ and PQR, XY = PQ and ∠X = ∠P. The two triangles are congruent by the SAS criterion if:
solution:
By the SAS (Side-Angle-Side) Criterion, two triangles are congruent if two sides and the included angle (the angle between the two sides) in one triangle are equal to the corresponding two sides and the included angle in the other triangle.

In the given question, we are told that:

XY = PQ

∠X=∠P

To apply the SAS criterion, we still need one more condition: the second side of the triangles must also be equal. So, the two triangles XYZ and PQR will be congruent by the SAS criterion if XZ = PR.

question: ∆KLM is right angled at L. If ∠K = 45°, then find the value of cosM.
solution:
In ∆KLM,

∠K = 45°

=> ∠M = 90° - 45° = 45°

cosM = cos45° = 1/√2

question: Kamal and Vimal can do a work in 40 hours and 60 hours respectively. If they worked on alternate hours starting from Kamal, then in how many hours the whole work will complete?
solution:
Total work = LCM of 40 and 60 = 120 units

Efficiency of Kamal = 120/40 = 3 units/hour

Efficiency of Vimal = 120/60 = 2 units/hour

Time taken by Kamal and Vimal to complete the work = 2*120/(2 + 3) = 48 hours

question: X: K = 9: 22, P: L = 4: 15, and K: L = 6: 5. If P = 308, then what is the value X?
Neeta took a loan from Meera and returned it in three equal quarterly instalments of ₹5160 each at simple interest. If the interest paid by her is ₹720, then what is the rate of interest?

A chef mixes two types of flour, one costing ₹180/kg and the other ₹220/kg, with a third type of flour. The ratio of the three types in the mix is 2:3:4. If the price of the mixture is ₹240/kg, find the price of the third type of flour.
solution:
Let the price of the third type of flour be Rs. A.

According to the question,

180 x 2 + 220 x 3 + 4 x A = (2 + 3 + 4) x 240

360 + 660 + 4A = 2160

4A = 1140

A = Rs.285

question:
Read the following data carefully and answer the following questions. The following table shows the average of the total number of chairs and tables manufactured by four shops and the ratio of the total number of chairs to tables manufactured by four shops.

The average of the total number of chairs and tables manufactured The ratio of the total number of chairs to tables manufactured
Shop A5401: 2
Shop B8403: 4
Shop C6506: 7
Shop D6809: 8

Find the total number of chairs manufactured by Shop A, Shop B, and Shop D together.
solution:
The total number of chairs manufactured by Shop A = (2 * 540) * 1/3 = 360

The total number of chairs manufactured by Shop B = (2 * 840) * 3/7 = 720

The total number of chairs manufactured by Shop D = (2 * 680) * 9/17 = 720

Hence, the required value = 360 + 720 + 720 = 1800

question: If a five-digit number 77X68 is divisible by 9, then find the smallest value of X.
solution:
[The divisibility rule for 9 states that a number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9]

7 + 7 + X + 6 + 8 = 28 + X

When we divide 28 by 9 remainder is 1.

So, X = 9 - 1 = 8

question: In a cuboid, the length is 18 cm more than its width and the width is twice its height. If the sum of length, width and height is 63 cm, then what is the volume of the cuboid?
solution:
Let the height of the cuboid be 'a' cm

Width = 2a cm

Length = 2a + 18 cm

A/Q

a + 2a + 2a + 18 = 63

5a = 45

a = 9 cm

The volume of the cuboid = L * B * H

= 9 * 18 * 36

= 5832 cm3

question: Select the sentence that contains a spelling error.
option_1: One of the most significant risks the group identified is mass automation and job displacement.
option_2: The mountains stood majjestically against the backdrop of a clear blue sky.
option_3: Biases and discrimination are other risks associated with AI.
option_4: The train rattled along the tracks, taking him farther away from home.
solution:
All the sentences have correct spelling except for the one mentioned in option (b).

The correct spelling is "majestically" which means in a way that is beautiful, powerful, or causes great admiration and respect.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

question: Describe how you will tell your parents that My brother drives the car in passive voice.
option_1: The car is driven by my brother.
option_2: The car was driven by my brother.
option_3: My brother is driving the car.
solution:
The subject of the Active Voice is changed into the object of the Passive Voice. Also, the object of the Active Voice is changed into the subject of the Passive Voice.

The usage of a "to be" form of the verb ['is'] is necessary while changing the voice of the sentence from Active to Passive.

In Passive Voice, the preposition "by" is used before the object. However, it is optional in some cases.

The Active voice in this question is in Present Indefinite. Thus, the Passive voice will also be in Present Indefinite.

The format of Active voice is: Subject + V1/V5 + Object.

Thus, in Passive voice, the format will be: Object of the active voice (Subjective case) + am/is/are + V3 + by + Subject of the active voice (Objective case).

For example:

She likes you. (Active Voice)

You are liked by her. (Passive Voice)

The options except (a) don't follow the correct grammatical format of the Passive Voice.

Therefore, the correct answer is: "The car is driven by my brother."

Hence, option (a) is correct.

question: What does the idiom "White elephant" mean?
solution:
A "white elephant" refers to something that is of significant value but difficult to maintain or care for, often a burden.

Usage: The committee discourages host cities from building sports venues that turn into costly white elephants.

Hence, option (a) is correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate idiom that can substitute the underlined words in the given sentence.

The manager gave the team a rap over the hands for missing the deadline, but no serious action was taken.
solution:
"A rap over the knuckles": A mild reprimand or scolding, often for a minor mistake or wrongdoing.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

question:
Choose the correct meaning of the boldened idiom in the given sentence.

The lights flickered off and on throughout the storm.
solution:
"Off and on" suggests that something is not constant. So, "intermittently" is the right choice.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word 'grin' from the following sentence.

I assumed things had gone well for him because he had a big smile on his face.
solution:
Grin - smile broadly.

So, 'smile' is its synonym.

Hence, option (c) is the answer.

solution: The given sentence is correct and hence no improvement is required. Option D is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the underlined group of words.

To her, meditation was a remedy for all ills, helping her cope with anxiety, depression, and even physical ailments.
solution:
'Panacea' is the appropriate one-word substitute for the underlined group of words.

The term 'panacea' describes a remedy or solution that cures all difficulties or problems.

'Parole' refers to the release of a prisoner from prison before the end of their sentence, on the condition that they behave well.

'Fable' refers to a short story, conveying a moral lesson.

'Axiom' refers to a statement or proposition that is regarded as being established, accepted, or self-evidently true.

Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Daunting
solution: 'Daunting' means 'Seeming difficult to deal with in prospect; intimidating'. Options c) and d) can be rejected as they are unrelated to the word. 'Discouraging' means 'Causing someone to lose confidence or enthusiasm; depressing'. Hence, option a) can also be rejected as it has the same meaning as the word. 'Cessation' means 'The fact or process of ending or being brought to an end'. 'Vilify' means 'Speak or write about in an abusively disparaging manner'. Hence, option b) is the correct answer.

question:
Parts of a sentence are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the parts in the correct order to form a meaningful sentence.

O. during challenging times

P. and support their communities

Q. hours to care for patients

R. a tireless job, dedicating countless

S. the healthcare workers did
solution:
After reading all the parts thoroughly, we can say that pairing S with R forms a logical start by introducing "the healthcare workers did a tireless job, dedicating countless". This opening effectively highlights the dedication of healthcare workers, setting up the context of their efforts. Next, pairing R with Q describes "countless hours to care for patients," building on their tireless commitment and focusing on their specific actions. Following this, P expands on their dedication to not only patients but also to "support their communities," broadening the impact of their efforts. Finally, O completes the sentence by situating their efforts "during challenging times," adding context to when these actions were most critical. Therefore, the correct order is SRQPO, making (d) the correct answer.

The final sentence: The healthcare workers did a tireless job, dedicating countless hours to care for patients and support their communities during challenging times.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The problem was solved by the expert.
option_2: The expert was solving the problem.
option_3: The problem will be solved by the expert.
option_4: The problem had being solved the expert.
solution:
The subject of the Passive Voice is changed into the object of the Active Voice. Also, the object of the Passive Voice is changed into the subject of the Active Voice.

The removal of the "to be" verb ['was' here] and the preposition 'by' is necessary while changing the voice of the sentence from Passive to Active.

The Passive voice in this question is in Past Indefinite. Thus, the Active voice will also be in Past Indefinite.

In Passive voice, the format is: Object of the Active voice (Subjective case) + was/were + V3 + by + Subject of the Active voice (Objective case).

Thus, the format of Active voice is: Subject + V2 + Object.

For example:

The Champions League was won by Real Madrid. (Passive Voice)

Real Madrid won the Champions League. (Active Voice)

The options except (a) don't follow the correct grammatical format of the Active Voice.

Therefore, the correct answer is: The expert solved the problem.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

It took her/ a hour to/ finish the workout/ at the gym.
solution:
The segment that contains a grammatical error is 'a hour to'.

The error is related to the article "a" before "hour."

The correct phrase should be "an hour," not "a hour," because the article "an" (not 'a') is used before words that begin with a vowel sound, such as "hour."

The article "a" is used before words that begin with a consonant sound. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: It took her an hour to finish the workout at the gym.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

If you are struggling/ with the assignment,/ I will help you/ completed it.
solution:
The segment that contains a grammatical error is 'completed it'.

The error is related to the verb "completed."

When we form future tense sentences with "will", we use the base form of the verb that follows "will."

The correct form in this case should be "complete", not "completed" [past form verb]. "Complete" is the base form of the verb that should follow "will" to indicate the action of completing. Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: If you are struggling with the assignment, I will help you complete it.

question:
Select the grammatically correct sentence.

A. The workers in the factory has been working overtime.

B. The workers in the factory is working overtime.

C. The workers in the factory have been working overtime.

D. The workers in the factory was working overtime.
solution:
Sentence C is correct. "Workers" is a plural subject, so the plural verb "have" correctly agrees with it. The phrase "have been working" is in the present perfect continuous tense, which appropriately describes an ongoing action that started in the past and continues into the present. 'Is', 'was' and 'has' are singular verbs and hence incorrect.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

Our country has the least discrimination because there are laws which _____discrimination based on race and gender.
solution: Proscribe means to prohibit. Hence it fits the context. Prescribe means state authoritatively or as a rule that (an action or procedure) should be carried out. A country with the least discrimination won't prescribe such rules. Describe means giving a detailed account in words. Subscribe means arrange to receive something. Both of these don't fit the context. Option B is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

JOVIAL
solution:
Jovial - cheerful, happy and friendly. Cheerful - noticeably happy and optimistic; despondent - in low spirits from loss of hope or courage; gloomy - causing or feeling depression or despondency; woeful - characterized by, expressive of, or causing sorrow or misery.

Thus, 'cheerful' is the only word that can be a synonym of the word 'jovial'. Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution: The word given in option A is spelt incorrectly. The correct spelling is 'benevolent'. It means kind and helpful. Option A is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate antonym of the underlined word in a sentence.

The artist created a whimsical painting with bright colours and imaginative characters.
solution:
Whimsical: Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.

Comical: Causing laughter or amusement; funny.

Eccentric: Unconventional and slightly strange; peculiar or odd.

Amusing: Entertaining and causing laughter or enjoyment.

Serious: Demanding careful consideration or application; not light-hearted or humorous.

Among the given options, the word 'serious' is opposite in meaning to the word 'whimsical'. So, the two words can be used as antonyms of each other.

Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A person who withdraws from society to live in isolation
solution:
"Tramp" refers to a person who has no home or job and who moves from place to place.

A "rebel" is someone who resists or opposes authority, control, or societal norms.

A "hermit" is a person who withdraws from society to live in solitude, often for religious, spiritual, or personal reasons.

A "wanderer" is a person who roams from place to place without a fixed home or purpose.

Hence, option (c) is correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Modest
solution:
Glum- Looking or feeling dejected; morose.

Sullen- Bad-tempered and sulky.

Unhappy- Not happy.

Conceited- Excessively proud of oneself; vain.

The meaning of the word 'modest' is 'unassuming in the estimation of one's abilities or achievements'. Among the given options, the word that is opposite in meaning to the word 'modest' is option (d) 'conceited'.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Self-care is an essential __ (1) __ of nurturing oneself, finding solace amidst the __ (2) __ of daily life. It begins by listening to the whispers of our bodies, honouring their needs with compassion. Taking a __ (3) __ breath, we embrace moments of stillness, finding peace within. Nurturing our minds, we engage in activities that bring joy and relaxation. We __ (4) __ rest, sleep, and nourishing meals, for replenishing our energy. With self-care, we create a sanctuary of self-love, acknowledging that we __ (5) __ moments of rejuvenation and self-discovery.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank No. 1.
solution:
The sentence with blank 1 talks about how self-care nurtures a person. Among the given options, 'act' fits in the blank appropriately as its usage conveys that self-care is an important activity of taking care of oneself. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

The rest of the options render the sentence meaningless.

Tactic- An action or strategy carefully planned to achieve a specific end.
